TopicTitle: [WIP] KopernicusTech - An integration attempt between Kopernicus and KittopiaTech (v0.13 - 03/26/15)

Articles.Content:
Hey Brosb! I'm having a hard time squshing some bugs on my pack!!! Can you take a look? I don't even Know what I'm doing wrong!

Link to pack

Here's what it looks like...

I started a wiki (couple days ago, but didn't had time yet) that will give information about all the planets in the Kerbol System.

By this I ask if the planet creators can add their own planets (I'll have a template for it later this day), if you don't have time, I'll add them for them.

You mean like a Kopernicus/KopernicusTech wiki? If so, i had the same idea too!

You mean like a Kopernicus/KopernicusTech wiki? If so, i had the same idea too!

I primarily created it for having all the planet information on one location, but I also planned to have tutorials on the wiki for making planets with KT. It's also easy to contribute, you don't need an account to make/edit a page.

I primarily created it for having all the planet information on one location, but I also planned to have tutorials on the wiki for making planets with KT. It's also easy to contribute, you don't need an account to make/edit a page.

Can I have a link?

Can I have a link?

Forgot it to put it in my signature "Outer Planets Wiki"
Gravitasi, I sent a pull request with the changes I'v made so far. I haven't spent hours testing, but from what I'v seen it seems stable and hasn't had any issues.

I started a wiki (couple days ago, but didn't had time yet) that will give information about all the planets in the Kerbol System.

By this I ask if the planet creators can add their own planets (I'll have a template for it later this day), if you don't have time, I'll add them for them.

Very cool.
How many released mods are there for KopernicusTech now that it's a combined joint?

How many released mods are there for KopernicusTech now that it's a combined joint?

I think 10 to 15 planet packs

I think 10 to 15 planet packs

That seems really high. Even if it is true, the amount worth actually downloading and using is significantly smaller.

so how exactly are making planets with this different then making planets with PF CE?

and is it just as simple as a cfg edit to make a pf planet to work with this?

I think 10 to 15 planet packs

Actually, there are 2-3-4 planet packs:

The stable ones are Kirius and Kohman.

PF planets are buggy.

And OPM's newest version doesn't work with KoppernicusTech.

Sorry to criticize, but actually there's 8. You're forgetting Trans-Keptunian, Porp Gas Giant System, Terrestrial Planets and Minor Bodies. (And 7 if you don't include OPM)

By the way, I noticed that in your Google Docs mod page you have a "Kerbol+ Planets Pack (WIP)" mod. I'm curious, is that the mod that I abandoned work on a few months ago? (With Prominatus and all that?)

EDIT: I added a list of Planet Packs to the KopernicusTech wiki. Here: http://outer-planets.wikia.com/wiki/Planet_Packs

Edited February 26, 2015 by Nicholander

Actually, there are 2-3-4 planet packs:

And OPM's newest version doesn't work with KoppernicusTech.

What exactly doesn't work well? I'v had no issues.

Actually, there are 2-3-4 planet packs:

The stable ones are Kirius and Kohman.

PF planets are buggy.

And OPM's newest version doesn't work with KoppernicusTech.

EDIT: I added a list of Planet Packs to the KopernicusTech wiki. Here: http://outer-planets.wikia.com/wiki/Planet_Packs

Thx for that. It's almost weekend, so then I'll have time to work on the wiki.

Gravitasi, might I suggest you include a GameData folder above the Kopernicus/KittopiaSpace folders in the next update? It makes installation using generic mod managers easier, as then one doesn't have to manually add a GameData folder.

Just a quick request for the thread: could someone post a template for the Kopernicus and Kittopia config?

I've been having to take other planet packs and modifying them, but sometimes this can cause problems. I really want to make a planet from pure scratch.

There is an "official" one, that is Gravitasi's planet pack. Should be an excellent template to learn from. Also, back in the days, KCreator made some example configs demonstrating the stuff one could do with Kittopia - you will have to look for that in the respective thread.

There is an "official" one, that is Gravitasi's planet pack. Should be an excellent template to learn from. Also, back in the days, KCreator made some example configs demonstrating the stuff one could do with Kittopia - you will have to look for that in the respective thread.

I see. Thanks!

Olympic1, could you change the wiki's front page (On the Recent Events section) to mention OPM's 1.5.5 update? (I can't edit the front page) And maybe perhaps Plock Plus' 1.0.2 update too?

Edited February 28, 2015 by Nicholander

Olympic1, could you change the wiki's front page (On the Recent Events section) to mention OPM's 1.5.5 update? (I can't edit the front page) And maybe perhaps Plock Plus' 1.0.2 update too?

Done. Also planet pages are delayed because something is wrong with my templates and I'm sick .
Aww, get well soon!

I've been slowly adding objects to my RSS folder, and I've hit a roadblock. On smaller, non-spherical objects like Styx moon of Pluto I can use a Gilly template to add in the necessary non-spherical features.

However, I need to create a large, ellipsoid object. Namely, Haumea. Using a Gilly template isn't working.

Does anyone have experience with making Ellipsoid entities? Thanks!

I've been slowly adding objects to my RSS folder, and I've hit a roadblock. On smaller, non-spherical objects like Styx moon of Pluto I can use a Gilly template to add in the necessary non-spherical features.

However, I need to create a large, ellipsoid object. Namely, Haumea. Using a Gilly template isn't working.

Does anyone have experience with making Ellipsoid entities? Thanks!

Well, you can use PQS oblate or however it's called.
